p: Eucalyptus oil was characterized by the same MIC value (3 mg/mL) against Staphylococcus aureus, either as a free oil or after loading into NLC, indicating that encapsulation did not impair its antimicrobial activity. On the contrary, it showed an enhanced antimicrobial activity against Streptococcus pyogenes when encapsulated in NLC, because MIC values decreased from 1.5 mg/mL, for free oil, to 0.75 mg/mL, for NLC o/e.
